message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.MM, cs.IR. 

The paper deals with the problem of recognizing human actions from varied views, which is a common problem in computer vision and multimedia research. The paper proposes a novel method for learning view-invariant representations hierarchically, which involves incorporating a sample-affinity matrix, transferable dictionary pair learning, and unsupervised distribution adaptation. These techniques are commonly used in computer vision and machine learning research, which suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) sub-category. Additionally, the paper involves learning representations using deep learning techniques, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also involves unsupervised learning and distribution adaptation, which suggests that it may belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. The paper deals with video data, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.MM (Multimedia) sub-category. Finally, the paper involves learning representations for action recognition, which suggests that it may also belong to the cs.IR (Information Retrieval) sub-category.
